candidates.definition: Actions that establish, modify, or manipulate interpersonal connections and social bonds between people.

positive_examples: She decided to befriend her new coworker after the meeting.
He unfriended his ex-girlfriend on all social media platforms.
The two companies are cooperating on the joint venture.
She was gaslighting him by constantly denying things she had said.
They sent a friend request to connect on LinkedIn.
The therapist helped them work on building trust in their relationship.
negative_examples: The teacher was instructing the students about algebra.
He gave a presentation to the board of directors.
She commanded her troops to advance on the enemy position.
The police officer arrested the suspect for theft.
He negotiated the terms of the contract with the supplier.
She competed against him in the tennis tournament.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SocialCommunication, SocialControl, SocialConflict, SocialExchange

candidates.definition: Organized gatherings or activities where people come together for a specific purpose or occasion.

positive_examples: The wedding ceremony brought together family and friends from across the country.
Our weekly team meeting helps coordinate project timelines and responsibilities.
The chess tournament attracted players of all skill levels to compete.
The graduation ceremony celebrated the achievements of hundreds of students.
They scheduled a board meeting to discuss the quarterly financial results.
The cooking contest featured amateur chefs showcasing their signature dishes.
negative_examples: She had a casual conversation with her neighbor over the fence.
He sent an angry email threatening to sue the company.
The children were playing together in the backyard without any structure.
They bumped into each other unexpectedly at the grocery store.
The argument between the siblings escalated quickly at dinner.
She gave him a friendly wave from across the street.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Conflict, Negotiation, Intimacy, Cooperation

candidates.definition: Large-scale environmental problems that threaten ecosystems, human health, or sustainability through resource depletion or contamination.

positive_examples: The drought has caused widespread crop failure and water shortages across the region.
Industrial waste has contaminated the groundwater, making it unsafe to drink.
Overgrazing has turned fertile farmland into barren desert over the past decade.
The oil spill devastated marine life and coastal ecosystems for hundreds of miles.
Deforestation has led to massive soil erosion and flooding in the valley.
Chemical runoff from factories has created dead zones in the lake where nothing can survive.
negative_examples: The earthquake damaged several buildings and infrastructure in the city.
Rising sea levels due to climate change will affect coastal communities.
The hurricane brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to the coast.
Scientists are studying long-term climate patterns and temperature trends.
The volcano erupted, sending ash clouds into the atmosphere.
Forest fires spread rapidly due to dry conditions and high winds.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalDisasters, ClimateChange, War, EconomicCrisis, PublicHealthCrisis
